page.title: 09E GRINSTEAD LOCAL CONCERNS
page.content: There is some frustration over the rail service to London and lack of connections to the coast and the Gatwick area by train. While people wish to have access they want to retain the market town atmosphere and not to fuse into Crawley or become linked to a suburban sprawl. Parking space in the town is generally insuffucient and expensive and too little provision is made for office workers to park all day. Some concern is voiced over the spread of Gatwick airport, aircraft noise following any expansion and the lack of a bypass. Preservation of the towns character and old buildings is regarded as paramount, hence the watchdog east Grinstead Society. It is feared that the traffic explosion, both aerial & motor will destroy the qualities the area now represents.
